content: In this PR, @Yury G. Kudryashov renames Covby to CovBy in accordance to the naming convention. Otoh, @Yaël Dillies remarks that this might hinder typing speed, without much benefit.

/poll Which name should we go for

  • CovBy (new name)
  • Covby (old name)
I prefer to see word boundaries. Without capital B, it's natural to try to read it as a single word, the wonder what does it mean.
Though I rarely use this particular name.
I guess, it makes no sense to use different conventions in these 2 cases. Either Covby and WCovby or CovBy and WCovBy.
A majority is in favour of this change, so I kicked it on the queue
